result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis M Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Curtis M Hill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Curtis M Hill was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of right to seek postconviction relief.
Status conference on April 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mario D. White.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Curtis M Hill in court with attorney Mario D. White. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. ADA and Atty White working on a plea agreement that includes defendant completing parenting class which ends next week.  Ct. will set another status next week but keep trial on the calendar.
Status conference at 04-08-2016 08:30 am
Defn set to attend parenting class in March.  Set for pleas in 60 days after.
Status conference at 01-13-2016 10:15 am
Atty White advised Defendant had contacted a program about attending parenting classes but he had not received a return call; case will be set for another STC in January 2016
Status conference at 12-22-2015 09:00 am

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Counsel jointly requested the case be taken off the trial calendar and set for another status conference in approximately 60 days; Defendant had been found ineligible for the Deferred Prosecution Program and the State's offer to the Defendant for resolution of this matter would be that the Defendant enroll in and complete a parenting class; Court will set for a stauts conference in approximately 30 days and take the case off the trial calendar
Status conference at 11-19-2015 09:45 am

ADDRESS INFO for Curtis M Hill

Prior: 6741 Schroeder Rd Apt 1, c/o Clifton Jones, Madison, WI 53711 United States

Counsel jointly requested the Court reschedule the JS/JT in approximately 30 days to allow them to speak with the Director of the Deferred Prosecution Program to hopefully have the Defendant accepted into the program; Court granted request
Status conference at 10-19-2015 02:30 pm
Court adjourned jury selection; Atty Sattler requested setover due to discovery issues; Defendant did not object; Court granted request and will reschedule JS/JT

Court Reporter: Philip Harrelson
Court conducted Ludwig hearing; State's offer to resolve the case is that the Defendant would enter a plea to the charge and the State would recommend two years probation with conditions but not request any conditional jail time; Defendant rejected the State's offer; case to be left on trial calendar

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
